dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so today, we're diving into a true icon, Madonna. And, um, I was just looking at these stats, right? Back in 1990, Forbes put her on the cover, asking: "America's Smartest Business Woman?" That, like, really stuck with me.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. And for good reason, right? I mean, fast forward to this May, and Forbes calculates her net worth at $590 million. Like, wow.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's, uh, that's wild. And she's ranked 36th among America's wealthiest self-made women. Pretty incredible, you know?

dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And, um, speaking of incredible money, Pollstar says her average gross per tour stop over the past three years was over three million dollars. But then, get this: zero shows played since the beginning of 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Zero? [interrupts] That's wild! But it just goes to show, like, her impact isn't just about touring anymore. She's still pulling in 1.6 million average daily YouTube views, according to the streaming giant.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no, I mean, "Vogue" alone has, uh, 84 million views on YouTube. And let's not forget, she's got two Diamond-certified albums by the RIAA – 'Like a Virgin' and 'The Immaculate Collection.' That's like ten million-plus units each!
